intro: Camissonia subacaulis, commonly known as the slender camissonia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Camissonia subacaulis is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to coastal climates with mild temperatures and moderate precipitation.
